title: Greek parliament agrees bailout
text:
Greece’s parliament has given its backing to a draft agreement to a third bailout deal. 
The talks lasted through the night and into the morning, the BBC reported . 
The proposals will see tax rises and spending cuts imposed in return for around €85 billion. 
Greece is due to repay about €3.2bn to the European Central Bank (ECB) on August 20. 
Uncertainty in Greece has hit the country’s tourism market. 
Last month Thomas Cook took a £5 million hit in the lates market. 
There was better news yesterday though when Tui Group’s joint chief executive Peter Long said the company had seen no ill effects from the crisis.
